DataElement.preferredName: Medulloblastoma Genetic Finding Subclass Determination Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Genetic information used to determine the medulloblastoma subclass.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A malignant, invasive embryonal neoplasm arising from the cerebellum. It occurs predominantly in children and has the tendency to metastasize via the cerebrospinal fluid pathways. Signs and symptoms include truncal ataxia, disturbed gait, lethargy, headache, and vomiting. There are four histologic variants: classic medulloblastoma, large cell/anaplastic medulloblastoma, desmoplastic/nodular medulloblastoma, and medulloblastoma with extensive nodularity._A laboratory test result that indicates the status of a molecular genetic or cytogenetic event in a pathologic process._A taxonomic subdivisions more specific than class but more general than order._The establishment of a state or result.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant, invasive embryonal neoplasm arising from the cerebellum. It occurs predominantly in children and has the tendency to metastasize via the cerebrospinal fluid pathways. Signs and symptoms include truncal ataxia, disturbed gait, lethargy, headache, and vomiting. There are four histologic variants: classic medulloblastoma, large cell/anaplastic medulloblastoma, desmoplastic/nodular medulloblastoma, and medulloblastoma with extensive nodularity.:A laboratory test result that indicates the status of a molecular genetic or cytogenetic event in a pathologic process.:A taxonomic subdivisions more specific than class but more general than order.

Concepts.definition: A malignant, invasive embryonal neoplasm arising from the cerebellum or posterior fossa. It occurs predominantly in children and has the tendency to metastasize via the cerebrospinal fluid pathways. Signs and symptoms include truncal ataxia, disturbed gait, lethargy, headache, and vomiting. There are four histologic variants: classic medulloblastoma, large cell/anaplastic medulloblastoma, desmoplastic/nodular medulloblastoma, and medulloblastoma with extensive nodularity.
A laboratory test result that indicates the status of a molecular genetic or cytogenetic event in a pathologic process.
A taxonomic subdivisions more specific than class but more general than order.

Property.preferredDefinition: The establishment of a state or result.
